channel.title: BitTorrent
channel.description:
Yet another BitTorrent post. I'm not downloading anything right now, so I'll just post this. Source: http://ascape.bounceme.net/Forum/
[img]http://upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/ilo/thumb/d/d5/BitTorrent_96.png/200px-BitTorrent_96.png[/img]
BitTorrent is a protocol for distributing files. It identifies content by URL and is designed to integrate seamlessly with the web. Its advantage over plain HTTP is that when multiple downloads of the same file happen concurrently, the downloaders upload to each other, making it possible for the file source to support very large numbers of downloaders with only a modest increase in its load.
Translation: It's a Peer-To-Peer protocol, by which to spread files. One initial person makes a .torrent file and spreads it to a group of people. The group of people then start downloading simultaneously from the initial person, but instead of downloading from the top down, each person downloads a different piece of the file from the initial person, and then spread the pieces of the file they have amongst themselves.
You can get faster speeds with BitTorrent than you can with regular downloading because you're downloading from multiple sources, plus it uses up less of a server's bandwidth. All the server has to do is to provide the .torrent file.
You can find virtually anything on BitTorrent - Software, Movies, Anime, Music, and even some legal stuff! :D
Several BitTorrent clients exist, such as Azureus, µTorrent, and BitComet. From what I've seen, Azureus is the biggest client, and µTorrent is the smallest client. µTorrent and Azureus have similar features, only Azureus takes up several hundred times more space.
Good BitTorrent Clients:
[ul][li][url=http://www.utorrent.com/]µTorrent[/url][/li] [li][url=http://azureus.sourceforge.net/]Azureus[/url][/li] [li][url=http://www.bittorrent.com/]Official Client[/url][/li][/ul]
Depending on your preferences, I'd recommend either Azureus or µTorrent. If you don't mind large memory usage and file size, and like to see a lot of information, I'd recommend Azureus. If you like light-weight applications which don't use much power, I'd recommend µTorrent. The official client provides almost no information about your download except the percentage finished.
You can get torrents from several sites. These sites are called torrent trackers. They only monitor the seeds and peers on the torrent and provide the .torrent file for download. They also have a nifty :D search function to find whatever you want.
There are several really good BitTorrent trackers out there, but I'd recommend The Pirate Bay and TorrentSpy the most. My favorite is The Pirate Bay. Private trackers also exist, hosted and maintained by groups spreading their own material.
Good BitTorrent Trackers:
[ul][li][url=http://www.thepiratebay.org]The Pirate Bay[/url][/li] [li][url=http://www.torrentspy.com/]TorrentSpy[/url][/li][/ul]
BitTorrent is a very good way to get your hands on that ever e-loot you want. :)

item.title: BitTorrent
item.dc:creator: @leader leader
item.description:
@leader wrote:

[quote=“Ron, post:11, topic:20186”][quote author=Mr.Chris link=topic=30629.msg355391#msg355391 date=1161966605]
BitComet is much faster and much more options and a much more friendly interface. I hate BitTorrent. One reason being, it never worked for me.

Great guide though. Well done.
[/quote]

If you read up on news on BitComet, they will tell you that BitComet doesn’t follow the BitTorrent protocol as well as other BitTorrent clients. That’s one of it’s major faults and that means less seeds, which means lower download rates.

That’s also why demonoid.com can’t track people using BitComet.

I saw a huge change when I switched from BitComet to µTorrent. :)[/quote]

Yes, µTorrent is small and fast.

Read full topic

item.title: BitTorrent
item.dc:creator: @Ron Ron
item.description:
@Ron wrote:

[quote=“Mr.Chris, post:5, topic:20186”]BitComet is much faster and much more options and a much more friendly interface. I hate BitTorrent. One reason being, it never worked for me.

Great guide though. Well done.[/quote]

If you read up on news on BitComet, they will tell you that BitComet doesn’t follow the BitTorrent protocol as well as other BitTorrent clients. That’s one of it’s major faults and that means less seeds, which means lower download rates.

That’s also why demonoid.com can’t track people using BitComet.

I saw a huge change when I switched from BitComet to µTorrent.

Read full topic

item.description:
@D27L7T wrote:

lizhang:

is pirate bay in german or something? anyway i use demonoid to search for my torrents

It’s a Swedish site. But it’s in English, mostly.

item.title: BitTorrent
item.dc:creator: @D27L7T D27L7T
item.description:
@D27L7T wrote:

[quote=“Mr.Chris, post:5, topic:20186”]BitComet is much faster and much more options and a much more friendly interface. I hate BitTorrent. One reason being, it never worked for me.

Great guide though. Well done.[/quote]

Thanks. BitComet/BitLord’s banned from a lot of private trackers, because of a bug in some versions that lets people download a private torrent without signing up on the tracker.

Read full topic

item.title: BitTorrent
item.dc:creator: @D27L7T D27L7T
item.description:
@D27L7T wrote:

Salemthegoodkitty:

What program you use? i use utorrent

I use µTorrent and Azureus.

lizhang:

I find that if i have azureus on i can’t go on the web.

Probably because you’re uploading and downloading from so many connections. Try to lower your upload speed.

Read full topic
